ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: learned the science behind global warming and the greenhouse effect
Developed understanding of the historical development of climate physics and the ability to engage knowledgeably with contemporary issues relating to climate change.
General idea about the historical evolution of climate warming science and also I learnt about important concepts such as feedbacks from the first-hand writings.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: excellent guided tour through seminal literature in the field Weakness: at times class felt a little too big for discussions
Student presentation and discussion is quite successful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Good background for scientific basis behind issues we're increasingly seeing in the media, and it was a relatively easy course with not many assignments
Yes, I greatly enjoyed learning so much both about the science itself as well as the context for these important discoveries and how that relates to further development in the future.
This course could be quite challenging If you have never taken classes on climate science.
